trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Search in NodeJS | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Search in NodeJS | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Walk through building a custom Azure Search application using NodeJS as your programming language.
trans-unit.target: Walk through building a custom Azure Search application using NodeJS as your programming language.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Search in NodeJS
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Search in NodeJS

trans-unit.source: Learn how to build a custom NodeJS search application that uses Azure Search for its search experience.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to build a custom NodeJS search application that uses Azure Search for its search experience.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the <link><linkText>Azure Search Service REST API</linkText><title></title></link> to construct the objects and operations used in this exercise.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the <link><linkText>Azure Search Service REST API</linkText><title></title></link> to construct the objects and operations used in this exercise.

trans-unit.source: We used <link><linkText>NodeJS</linkText><title></title></link> and NPM, <link><linkText>Sublime Text 3</linkText><title></title></link>, and Windows PowerShell on Windows 8.1 to develop and test this code.
trans-unit.target: We used <link><linkText>NodeJS</linkText><title></title></link> and NPM, <link><linkText>Sublime Text 3</linkText><title></title></link>, and Windows PowerShell on Windows 8.1 to develop and test this code.

trans-unit.source: To run this sample, you need an Azure Search service, which you can sign up for in the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To run this sample, you need an Azure Search service, which you can sign up for in the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Download the source code for this tutorial at <link><linkText>AzureSearchNodeJSIndexerDemo</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Download the source code for this tutorial at <link><linkText>AzureSearchNodeJSIndexerDemo</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: About the data
trans-unit.target: About the data

trans-unit.source: This sample application uses data from the <link><linkText>United States Geological Services (USGS)</linkText><title></title></link>, filtered on the state of Rhode Island to reduce the dataset size.
trans-unit.target: This sample application uses data from the <link><linkText>United States Geological Services (USGS)</linkText><title></title></link>, filtered on the state of Rhode Island to reduce the dataset size.

trans-unit.source: We'll use this data to build a search application that returns landmark buildings such as hospitals and schools, as well as geological features like streams, lakes, and summits.
trans-unit.target: We'll use this data to build a search application that returns landmark buildings such as hospitals and schools, as well as geological features like streams, lakes, and summits.

trans-unit.source: In this application, the DataIndexer program builds and loads the index using an Indexer construct, retrieving the filtered USGS dataset from a public Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: In this application, the DataIndexer program builds and loads the index using an Indexer construct, retrieving the filtered USGS dataset from a public Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Credentials and connection information to the online data source is provided in the program code.
trans-unit.target: Credentials and connection information to the online data source is provided in the program code.

trans-unit.source: No further configuration is necessary.
trans-unit.target: No further configuration is necessary.

trans-unit.source: We applied a filter on this dataset to stay under the 10,000 document limit of the free pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: We applied a filter on this dataset to stay under the 10,000 document limit of the free pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: If you use the standard tier, this limit does not apply.
trans-unit.target: If you use the standard tier, this limit does not apply.

trans-unit.source: For details about capacity for each pricing tier, see <link><linkText>Limits and constraints</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about capacity for each pricing tier, see <link><linkText>Limits and constraints</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create the service
trans-unit.target: Create the service

trans-unit.source: Sign in to <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click New > Data + Storage > Search.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click New > Data + Storage > Search.

trans-unit.source: Configure the service name, pricing tier, resource group, subscription and location.
trans-unit.target: Configure the service name, pricing tier, resource group, subscription and location.

trans-unit.source: These settings are required and cannot be changed once the service is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: These settings are required and cannot be changed once the service is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: Service name must be unique, lower-case, under 15 characters, with no spaces.
trans-unit.target: Service name must be unique, lower-case, under 15 characters, with no spaces.

trans-unit.source: This name becomes part of the endpoint of your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: This name becomes part of the endpoint of your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Naming Rules</linkText><title></title></link> for more information about naming conventions.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Naming Rules</linkText><title></title></link> for more information about naming conventions.

trans-unit.source: Pricing Tier determines capacity and billing.
trans-unit.target: Pricing Tier determines capacity and billing.

trans-unit.source: Both tiers provide the same features, but at different resource levels.
trans-unit.target: Both tiers provide the same features, but at different resource levels.

trans-unit.source: Free runs on clusters that are shared with other subscribers.
trans-unit.target: Free runs on clusters that are shared with other subscribers.

trans-unit.source: It offers enough capacity to try out tutorials and write proof-of-concept code, but is not intended for production applications.
trans-unit.target: It offers enough capacity to try out tutorials and write proof-of-concept code, but is not intended for production applications.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a free service typically only takes a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a free service typically only takes a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: Standard runs on dedicated resources and is highly scalable.
trans-unit.target: Standard runs on dedicated resources and is highly scalable.

trans-unit.source: Initially, a standard service is provisioned with one replica and one partition, but you can adjust capacity once the service is created.
trans-unit.target: Initially, a standard service is provisioned with one replica and one partition, but you can adjust capacity once the service is created.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a standard service takes longer, usually about fifteen minutes.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a standard service takes longer, usually about fifteen minutes.

trans-unit.source: Resource Groups are containers for services and resources used for a common purpose.
trans-unit.target: Resource Groups are containers for services and resources used for a common purpose.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you're building a custom search application based on Azure Search, Azure Websites, Azure BLOB storage, you could create a resource group that keeps these services together in the portal management pages.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you're building a custom search application based on Azure Search, Azure Websites, Azure BLOB storage, you could create a resource group that keeps these services together in the portal management pages.

trans-unit.source: Subscription allows you to choose among multiple subscriptions, if you have more than one subscription.
trans-unit.target: Subscription allows you to choose among multiple subscriptions, if you have more than one subscription.

trans-unit.source: Location is the data center region.
trans-unit.target: Location is the data center region.

trans-unit.source: Currently, all resources must run in the same data center.
trans-unit.target: Currently, all resources must run in the same data center.

trans-unit.source: Distributing resources across multiple data centers is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Distributing resources across multiple data centers is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Click Create to provision the service.
trans-unit.target: Click Create to provision the service.

trans-unit.source: Watch for notifications in the Jumpbar.
trans-unit.target: Watch for notifications in the Jumpbar.

trans-unit.source: A notice appears when the service is ready to use.
trans-unit.target: A notice appears when the service is ready to use.

trans-unit.source: Find the service name and api-key of your Azure Search service
trans-unit.target: Find the service name and api-key of your Azure Search service

trans-unit.source: After you create the service, return to the portal to get the URL or api-key.
trans-unit.target: After you create the service, return to the portal to get the URL or api-key.

trans-unit.source: Connections to your Search service require that you have both the URL and an api-key to authenticate the call.
trans-unit.target: Connections to your Search service require that you have both the URL and an api-key to authenticate the call.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click Home and then click the Search service to open the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click Home and then click the Search service to open the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: On the service dashboard, you'll see tiles for essential information, as well as the key icon for accessing the admin keys.
trans-unit.target: On the service dashboard, you'll see tiles for essential information, as well as the key icon for accessing the admin keys.

trans-unit.source: Copy the service URL, an admin key, and a query key.
trans-unit.target: Copy the service URL, an admin key, and a query key.

trans-unit.source: You'll need all three later, when you add them to the config.js file.
trans-unit.target: You'll need all three later, when you add them to the config.js file.

trans-unit.source: Download the sample files
trans-unit.target: Download the sample files

trans-unit.source: Use either one of the following approaches to download the sample.
trans-unit.target: Use either one of the following approaches to download the sample.

trans-unit.source: Go to <link><linkText>AzureSearchNodeJSIndexerDemo</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Go to <link><linkText>AzureSearchNodeJSIndexerDemo</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Download ZIP, save the .zip file, and then extract all the files it contains.
trans-unit.target: Click Download ZIP, save the .zip file, and then extract all the files it contains.

trans-unit.source: All subsequent file modifications and run statements will be made against files in this folder.
trans-unit.target: All subsequent file modifications and run statements will be made against files in this folder.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, if you have GIT in your path statement, you can open a PowerShell window and type git clone https://github.com/EvanBoyle/AzureSearchNodeJSIndexerDemo.git
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, if you have GIT in your path statement, you can open a PowerShell window and type git clone https://github.com/EvanBoyle/AzureSearchNodeJSIndexerDemo.git

trans-unit.source: Update the config.js. with your Search service URL and api-key
trans-unit.target: Update the config.js. with your Search service URL and api-key

trans-unit.source: Using the URL and api-key that you copied earlier, specify the URL, admin-key, and query-key in configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Using the URL and api-key that you copied earlier, specify the URL, admin-key, and query-key in configuration file.

trans-unit.source: Admin keys grant full control over service operations, including creating or deleting an index and loading documents.
trans-unit.target: Admin keys grant full control over service operations, including creating or deleting an index and loading documents.

trans-unit.source: In contrast, query keys are for read-only operations, typically used by client applications that connect to Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, query keys are for read-only operations, typically used by client applications that connect to Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: In this sample, we include the query key to help reinforce the best practice of using the query key in client applications.
trans-unit.target: In this sample, we include the query key to help reinforce the best practice of using the query key in client applications.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows config.js open in a text editor, with the relevant entries demarcated so that you can see where to update the file with the values that are valid for your search service.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows config.js open in a text editor, with the relevant entries demarcated so that you can see where to update the file with the values that are valid for your search service.

trans-unit.source: Host a runtime environment for the sample
trans-unit.target: Host a runtime environment for the sample

trans-unit.source: The sample requires an HTTP server, which you can install globally using npm.
trans-unit.target: The sample requires an HTTP server, which you can install globally using npm.

trans-unit.source: Use a PowerShell window for the following commands.
trans-unit.target: Use a PowerShell window for the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the folder that contains the package.json file.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the folder that contains the package.json file.

trans-unit.source: Type npm install.
trans-unit.target: Type npm install.

trans-unit.source: Type npm install -g http-server.
trans-unit.target: Type npm install -g http-server.

trans-unit.source: Build the index and run the application
trans-unit.target: Build the index and run the application

trans-unit.source: Type npm run indexDocuments.
trans-unit.target: Type npm run indexDocuments.

trans-unit.source: Type npm run build.
trans-unit.target: Type npm run build.

trans-unit.source: Type npm run start_server.
trans-unit.target: Type npm run start_server.

trans-unit.source: Direct your browser at http://localhost:8080/index.html
trans-unit.target: Direct your browser at http://localhost:8080/index.html

trans-unit.source: Search on USGS data
trans-unit.target: Search on USGS data

trans-unit.source: The USGS data set includes records that are relevant to the state of Rhode Island.
trans-unit.target: The USGS data set includes records that are relevant to the state of Rhode Island.

trans-unit.source: If you click Search on an empty search box, you will get the top 50 entries, which is the default.
trans-unit.target: If you click Search on an empty search box, you will get the top 50 entries, which is the default.

trans-unit.source: Entering a search term will give the search engine something to go on.
trans-unit.target: Entering a search term will give the search engine something to go on.

trans-unit.source: Try entering a regional name.
trans-unit.target: Try entering a regional name.

trans-unit.source: "Roger Williams" was the first governor of Rhode Island.
trans-unit.target: "Roger Williams" was the first governor of Rhode Island.

trans-unit.source: Numerous parks, buildings, and schools are named after him.
trans-unit.target: Numerous parks, buildings, and schools are named after him.

trans-unit.source: You could also try any of these terms:
trans-unit.target: You could also try any of these terms:

trans-unit.source: Pawtucket
trans-unit.target: Pawtucket

trans-unit.source: Pembroke
trans-unit.target: Pembroke

trans-unit.source: goose +cape
trans-unit.target: goose +cape

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This is the first Azure Search tutorial based on NodeJS and the USGS dataset.
trans-unit.target: This is the first Azure Search tutorial based on NodeJS and the USGS dataset.

trans-unit.source: Over time, we'll extend this tutorial to demonstrate additional search features you might want to use in your custom solutions.
trans-unit.target: Over time, we'll extend this tutorial to demonstrate additional search features you might want to use in your custom solutions.

trans-unit.source: If you already have some background in Azure Search, you can use this sample as a springboard for trying suggesters (type-ahead or autocomplete queries), filters, and faceted navigation.
trans-unit.target: If you already have some background in Azure Search, you can use this sample as a springboard for trying suggesters (type-ahead or autocomplete queries), filters, and faceted navigation.

trans-unit.source: You can also improve upon the search results page by adding counts and batching documents so that users can page through the results.
trans-unit.target: You can also improve upon the search results page by adding counts and batching documents so that users can page through the results.

trans-unit.source: New to Azure Search?
trans-unit.target: New to Azure Search?

trans-unit.source: We recommend trying other tutorials to develop an understanding of what you can create.
trans-unit.target: We recommend trying other tutorials to develop an understanding of what you can create.

trans-unit.source: Visit our <link><linkText>documentation page</linkText><title></title></link> to find more resources.
trans-unit.target: Visit our <link><linkText>documentation page</linkText><title></title></link> to find more resources.

trans-unit.source: You can also view the links in our <link><linkText>Video and Tutorial list</linkText><title></title></link> to access more information.
trans-unit.target: You can also view the links in our <link><linkText>Video and Tutorial list</linkText><title></title></link> to access more information.
